content.raw: confirmed https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-xenial-i386/1/testReport/junit/(root)/SignalHandler/MultipleThreads/
content.html: confirmed https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-xenial-i386/1/testReport/junit/(root)/SignalHandler/MultipleThreads/

content.raw:
The `SignalHandler.MultipleThreads` is failing during the debbuild for 32-bit (`i386`) architectures:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-common2-debbuilder&build=2)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-common2-debbuilder/2/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-common2-debbuilder/2/

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-common2-debbuilder&build=4)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-common2-debbuilder/4/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-common2-debbuilder/4/

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-common2-debbuilder&build=6)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-common2-debbuilder/6/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-common2-debbuilder/6/

~~~
[ RUN      ] SignalHandler.MultipleThreads
unknown file: Failure
C++ exception with description "Resource temporarily unavailable" thrown in the test body.
[  FAILED  ] SignalHandler.MultipleThreads (36 ms)
~~~

I've also created a 32-bit xenial jenkins job to try to confirm the test failure:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_common-ci-pr_any-xenial-i386&build=1)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-xenial-i386/1/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-xenial-i386/1/
content.html:
The SignalHandler.MultipleThreads is failing during the debbuild for 32-bit (i386) architectures:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-common2-debbuilder/2/

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-common2-debbuilder/4/

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-common2-debbuilder/6/

[ RUN      ] SignalHandler.MultipleThreads
unknown file: Failure
C++ exception with description "Resource temporarily unavailable" thrown in the test body.
[  FAILED  ] SignalHandler.MultipleThreads (36 ms)

I've also created a 32-bit xenial jenkins job to try to confirm the test failure:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-xenial-i386/1/

content.html:
If we want to make the code portable we could replace the entire block inside the if with:

std::signal(SIGINT,  onSignal);
std::signal(SIGTERM, onSignal);

I'll leave it to you.

content.raw: Sorry, this used to be a vector which requires an iterator. Changed to use the key value.
content.html: Sorry, this used to be a vector which requires an iterator. Changed to use the key value.

update.description: This is a generic signal handler interface. Originally derived from: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/5
update.title: Added signal handler

content.raw: Do you mind to elaborate why?
content.html: Do you mind to elaborate why?

content.raw: Added.
content.html: Added.

content.raw: Changed to std::atomic<bool> and capture the value at the start of the function.
content.html: Changed to std::atomic<bool> and capture the value at the start of the function.

update.description: This is a generic signal handler interface. Originally derived from: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/5
update.title: Added signal handler

content.raw: That is not a valid use of erase.
content.html: That is not a valid use of erase.

content.raw:
The output of `<< signal << ` will not be text like "SIGINT". 

The current approach works, so I'll leave it as is.
content.html:
The output of << signal << will not be text like "SIGINT".

The current approach works, so I'll leave it as is.

content.raw: I'd rather use a more user-friendly output like "SIGINT" than `sa_mask`.
content.html: I'd rather use a more user-friendly output like "SIGINT" than sa_mask.

content.raw: That can be a future pull request.
content.html: That can be a future pull request.

content.raw: Consider to remove `result` and return `this->dataPtr->initialized` instead.
content.html: Consider to remove result and return this->dataPtr->initialized instead.

content.raw: Should we lock a mutex here and in `OnSignal()`? Sounds like there's a potential race condition if we are calling `AddCallback()` and at the same time a signal is generated and the `onSignal()->OnSignal()` sequence is triggered.
content.html: Should we lock a mutex here and in OnSignal()? Sounds like there's a potential race condition if we are calling AddCallback() and at the same time a signal is generated and the onSignal()->OnSignal() sequence is triggered.

content.raw: `gOnSignalWrappers.erase(this->dataPtr->wrapperIndex);`?
content.html: gOnSignalWrappers.erase(this->dataPtr->wrapperIndex);?

How about replacing this block and the next one with:

for (auto signal : {SIGINT, SIGTERM})
{
  if (sigaction(signal, &sigact, nullptr))
  {
    ignerr << "Unable to catch signal [" << signal << "].\n"
           << " Please visit http://community.gazebosim.org for help.\n";
    return;
  }
}

content.raw: "while initializing sa_mask"?
content.html: "while initializing sa_mask"?

content.raw: I know that we capture most of the time `SIGINT` and `SIGTERM` signals but if this is a generic class, maybe we should support any signal.
content.html: I know that we capture most of the time SIGINT and SIGTERM signals but if this is a generic class, maybe we should support any signal.

content.raw: Added a minor tweak in 9d6ddee.
content.html: Added a minor tweak in 9d6ddee.

This looks good to me. I tried using this in ign-gui for a bit but I ran into other problems related to upgrading to ign-common2 so I'll try that a bit more later...

content.raw:
I added visibility macros to `SignalHandler.hh` in 5ef8ca2 to try to fix the windows build, but it's still broken

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_common-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64&build=427)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/427/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/427/

~~~
SignalHandler_TEST.cc.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol
 "class std::map<int,class std::function<void __cdecl(int)>,struct std::less<int>,class std::allocator<struct std::pair<int const ,class std::function<void __cdecl(int)> > > >
 gOnSignalWrappers"
 (?gOnSignalWrappers@@3V?$map@HV?$function@$$A6AXH@Z@std@@U?$less@H@2@V?$allocator@U?$pair@$$CBHV?$function@$$A6AXH@Z@std@@@std@@@2@@std@@A)
..\bin\UNIT_SignalHandler_TEST.exe : fatal error LNK1120: 1 unresolved externals
LINK failed. with 1120
~~~
content.html:
I added visibility macros to SignalHandler.hh in 5ef8ca2 to try to fix the windows build, but it's still broken

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/427/
SignalHandler_TEST.cc.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol
 "class std::map<int,class std::function<void __cdecl(int)>,struct std::less<int>,class std::allocator<struct std::pair<int const ,class std::function<void __cdecl(int)> > > >
 gOnSignalWrappers"
 (?gOnSignalWrappers@@3V?$map@HV?$function@$$A6AXH@Z@std@@U?$less@H@2@V?$allocator@U?$pair@$$CBHV?$function@$$A6AXH@Z@std@@@std@@@2@@std@@A)
..\bin\UNIT_SignalHandler_TEST.exe : fatal error LNK1120: 1 unresolved externals
LINK failed. with 1120
